meanings.definition: The quality of being assertive or aggressive in promoting oneself or one's ideas.
meanings.sent1: Her pushiness in the meeting made everyone listen to her ideas.
meanings.sent2: I don't appreciate his pushiness when trying to sell me something.
meanings.sent3: His pushiness in getting people to join his club was both annoying and effective.
meanings.sent4: The pushiness of the salesperson was like a bulldozer, unstoppable and forceful.
meanings.sent5: The pushiness of the politician left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: The act of pushing or shoving forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The pushiness of the crowd at the concert was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: He used his pushiness to move the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent3: The pushiness of the toddler trying to open the door was both amusing and determined.
meanings.sent4: The pushiness of the waves against the shore was relentless and powerful.
meanings.sent5: The pushiness of the wind against the trees created a symphony of rustling leaves.

meanings.definition: A behavior characterized by excessive persistence or insistence.
meanings.sent1: Her pushiness in asking for a raise was met with resistance from her boss.
meanings.sent2: The pushiness of the customer made the waiter uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The pushiness of the cat demanding attention was both cute and annoying.
meanings.sent4: The pushiness of the alarm clock in the morning is a necessary evil.
meanings.sent5: The pushiness of the student in pursuing extra credit assignments was commendable.
